title: Sony planning to manufacture Xperia smartphones in India
text: Sony planning to manufacture Xperia smartphones in India Writankar Mukherjee Writankar Mukherjee ,ET Bureau | Sep 4, 2015, 10.02 AM IST READ MORE Sony | Foxconn The Japanese consumer electronics major is finalizing a new strategy for the Indian market, which is its fourth largest after the US, China and Japan. RELATED KOLKATA: After televisions, Sony Corp plans to assemble its Xperia smartphones in India and manufacture a couple of sub-Rs 10,000 models, specifically designed for the local market. The company is in talks with Taiwan's top contract manufacturer Foxconn to assemble its smartphones in India and the first batch is likely to roll out this calendar year, three senior industry executives said. The Japanese consumer electronics major is finalizing a new strategy for the Indian market, which is its fourth largest after the US, China and Japan. The plan includes increasing revenue by boosting mobile phone sales, with the country poised to become the world's second largest smartphone market by 2017. Sony has globally decided to vacate the entry-level smartphone segment, but it has realised that it needs to have a couple of handsets in emerging markets since that segment accounts for more than 70% of industry sales. Local assembling and manufacturing of smartphones provide the makers duty benefit of 6% to 6.5%, which is aimed at encouraging the government's Make in India initiative. First look: Sony Xperia Z5 of 7 Sony Xperia Z5 is the company’s new flagship smartphone. Unveiled at IFA 2015, Berlin, the device boasts features such as a fingerprint sensor and an improved 23MP rear camera. Here’s a close look at the phone…. Sony Xperia Z5 follows the company’s OmniBalance philosophy featuring clean lines, slightly curved edges and angular design. It has a metal frame and soft corners to absorb bumps. It comes in Graphite Black, White, Gold and Green colours. Unlike its bigger sibling Xperia Z5 Premium, the Z5 features a frosted glass back that comes with a soft matte finish which looks great and feels nice to hold. It’s also less prone to smudges. The Sony Xperia Z5 sports a 5.2-inch Full-HD 1080p (1920x1080)Triluminos display for Mobile. It features X-Reality for Mobileand Dynamic Contrast Enhancer making images and videos look more vivid. Xperia Z5 doesn't feature a watch-crown shaped power button and has a pill-shaped metal power key that also doubles up as a finger-print sensor.
